org.swisscheese.swisscheese.gameSaving

Class GameSaveManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.swisscheese.swisscheese.gameSaving.GameSaveManager

  • public final class GameSaveManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for managing serialized GameSave objects. Operations such as creation (serialization), opening (deserialization) and deletion could be done through this GameSaveManager class.

    This class saves all GameSaves to a list, and then saves the list to file. All GameSave objects are in the same file.

    All actions involving serialization are done through the GSON library.

    Since:
    2018-12-28, v0.5
    Version:
    v1.0
    Author:
    Alex Kalinins
    See Also:
    Gson

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static final GameSaveManager getInstance()
        Lazy initialization for GameSaveManager.

        If MANAGER is null, then this method calls the constructor to create a new instance of GameSaveManager. Otherwise, no new instance is created. In any case, the method returns MANAGER.

        Returns:
        MANAGER

      • saveGame

        public void saveGame(GameSave save)
        Adds the GameSave save to list, calls GameSaveList.sort() and calls writeToFile(GameSaveList). Also deletes any duplicate GameSave objects..
        Parameters:
        save - the GameSave being added to the list and saved.

      • deleteGame

        public void deleteGame(int index)
        Deletes a game of index from the list. If the list is empty (size == 0), FILE is deleted.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the GameSave being deleted.

      • makeList

        private GameSaveList makeList()
        Creates a new GameSaveList object.

        Should only be done if a no existing GameSaveList objects exist in serialized form.

        Returns:
        a new GameSaveList

      • readFromFile

        private GameSaveList readFromFile()
        Opens file and deserializes GameSaveList.
        Returns:
        a GameSaveList from FILE.

      • searchList

        private int searchList(GameSave save)
        Linear search of the list to find save. Linear search was used instead of binary search because comparison must be made based on save's identifier and name and not its Calendar
        Parameters:
        save - the query of the search
        Returns:
        the index of the found save or -1 if the search was unsuccessful.

      • writeToFile

        private void writeToFile(GameSaveList list)
        Serializes and writes list to the FILE File.
        Parameters:
        list - a GameSaveList being serialized.

      • getList

        public final java.util.List<GameSave> getList()
